locutie.beschrijving: The sermon explores the concept of peace through the lens of Micah's prophecy, contrasting human efforts (Tibetan monks, UN, social activism) with the divine intervention of the Resurrection.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Strong use of biblical theology (Ecclesiastes, Micah, Luke) and historical analogy (Cullmann's D-Day).

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting the reality of human sin and the historical fact of the Resurrection, moving toward a promise of divine empowerment.
voorbeelden: The message of the New Testament is that this final intervention... began with the Crucifixion.
The peace of God is not peace as the world gives.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To move the hearer from cynicism/sentimentality to a grounded hope in God's victory.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Explicitly mentions 'power from on high' and the promise of Pentecost.

voorbeelden: It is a remarkable book of the Bible.
The Adam and Eve story doesn't have anything to do with evolution.
Don't let the literary beauty of Ecclesiastes fool you.
I'm truly sad about what this project has done.
He gives us power from on high.
He has won the victory for us also.
commissieven.kwaliteit: High theological content but often framed as general truths rather than direct address.

voorbeelden: I send the promise of my Father upon you.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher relies on quoting Jesus or the liturgy for declarative force.

indicatoren: Extensive storytelling about Buddhist monks and news reports.
Long sections explaining the literary nature of Ecclesiastes.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is well-informed and intellectually engaged but remains an observer of the 'event'.

missende_elementen: Direct individual promise ('God promises you today')
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: A sense of 'this is true for the world' rather than 'this is happening to me now'.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Theologically dense but often third-person ('The promise of the gospel is...').
voorbeelden: He gives us power from on high.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Anecdotal and homiletical navigation ('I think', 'I tell these stories').

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address used mostly in the final third to apply the message.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used to identify 'beachheads' for the Lord.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Dominant mode; describing monks, history, and biblical characters.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a lecture-like atmosphere for the first 60% of the text.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General truths about human nature and sin.

actueel_present.gebruik: The 'now' of the liturgical moment and the current struggle of the hearer.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from the reality of sin (Assertive) to the Resurrection (Commissive) to the life of the believer (Directive).
voorbeelden: The Son of God... has taken away the sin... when you trust in the Lord, it is not sand poured in the river.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The transition to the 'Toezegging' (Promise) is present but buried under narrative.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: In God, our toil is meaningful... because he gives us power from on high.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon is a high-quality theological reflection that successfully points to the Gospel, but it functions more as a 'testimony to the truth' than a 'sacramental event' because of the high constative load.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Sentimentality is a premature rush to believe in innocence without grasping the reality of the Fall.
sterke_punten.effect: Establishes a credible foundation for the Gospel.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The long stories about Buddhist monks in South Carolina and Cambodia.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Delays the illocutionary force of the Gospel.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon 'happens' mostly at the end when it connects the Resurrection to the hearer's 'beachhead'.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher speaks *about* the sacrament (Proper Preface) rather than speaking *sacramentally* (direct declaration).

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Implicitly through the reading of the Word and the Liturgy.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: The preacher acts as an interpreter of the times and the text.
tekstueel_bewijs: The promise of the gospel is...

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Yes, via the 'power from on high'.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: The effect is framed as 'believing that makes all the difference'.
tekstueel_bewijs: clothed with power from on high

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: The sermon points to the Eucharist as the means of grace rather than being one itself.
tekstueel_bewijs: Listen to its concreteness... which you will hear in a few minutes.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Too many 'is' and 'was' verbs; needs more 'gives', 'frees', and 'promises'.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The promise of the gospel is that the course of the world has been definitively changed.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Today, Christ changes the course of your world.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a general fact to a present-tense event.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is often attributed to 'the New Testament' or 'the prophets' rather than the preacher's mouth.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Use the first person representative voice.
voorbeeldzinnen: On behalf of Christ, I promise you: your toil is not in vain.
You, who are struggling with cancer, hear this: Christ has won the victory for you.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The balance is actually quite good; the imperatives are well-grounded.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Keep the grounding but make the indicative more performative.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A deeply intelligent and orthodox sermon that provides excellent 'locutionary' content, but could be transformed into a more powerful 'event' by reducing the constative surplus of the anecdotes.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: Unlike SvT, which would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' or 'appeal', SAT reveals that the preacher is attempting a Commissive actâ€”binding God's promise to the congregation.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric would praise the 'beachhead' metaphor; SAT asks if the metaphor actually *delivers* the peace it describes.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT identifies that the sermon's power is diluted by its 'talking about' the liturgy rather than 'performing' the liturgy's claims in the preaching moment.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: He has won for us everlasting life.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: High - this is the core of the Gospel event.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: The romanticizing of Tibetan Buddhism is one of the more interesting things going on in America today.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Low - informative but distracts from the sacramental moment.

appendices.notities: The sermon is highly literary and effective as an essay, but the 'event' character is secondary to the 'informative' character.
